factions.name: Republic
factions.description: A form of government where power is held by elected representatives

factions.name: City-State
factions.description: An independent sovereign city that controls surrounding territory

factions.name: Noble House
factions.description: A family of aristocrats with hereditary titles and political influence

factions.name: Alliance
factions.description: A formal partnership between multiple groups for mutual benefit

factions.name: Coalition
factions.description: A temporary alliance of different groups united for a specific purpose

factions.name: Confederation
factions.description: A loose association of independent groups that maintain autonomy

factions.name: Federation
factions.description: A union of groups under central authority with some independence

factions.name: Bloc
factions.description: A group of nations or organizations united for common purpose

factions.name: Axis
factions.description: A central alliance around which other groups align

factions.name: Front
factions.description: A united group formed to achieve a common goal

factions.name: Confederacy
factions.description: A loose alliance of independent states united for mutual benefit

factions.name: Council
factions.description: A governing body of representatives who make decisions collectively

factions.name: Parliament
factions.description: A legislative assembly that represents the people

factions.name: Ministry
factions.description: A government department or religious organization

factions.name: Theocracy
factions.description: A government ruled by religious leaders or divine authority

factions.name: Oligarchy
factions.description: A government ruled by a small group of powerful individuals

factions.name: Democracy
factions.description: A government where power is held by the people through voting

factions.name: Autocracy
factions.description: A government with absolute power held by a single ruler

factions.name: Dictatorship
factions.description: A government ruled by a dictator with absolute authority

factions.name: Monarchy
factions.description: A government ruled by a monarch

factions.name: Junta
factions.description: A military group ruling after seizing power

factions.name: Triumvirate
factions.description: A political alliance of three powerful individuals

factions.name: Regency
factions.description: A government acting on behalf of an absent ruler

factions.name: Aristocracy
factions.description: A government ruled by a privileged class of nobles

factions.name: Plutocracy
factions.description: A government ruled by the wealthy elite

factions.name: Meritocracy
factions.description: A government where positions are based on ability

factions.name: Technocracy
factions.description: A government ruled by technical experts and scientists

factions.name: Commune
factions.description: A self-governing community with shared resources

factions.name: League
factions.description: An alliance of cities or states for defense or trade

factions.name: Union
factions.description: A political entity formed by combination of multiple states

factions.name: Syndicate
factions.description: A group of individuals working together for mutual benefit

factions.name: Consortium
factions.description: An association of companies for a common purpose

factions.name: Cartel
factions.description: Independent organizations working to control markets

factions.name: Hegemony
factions.description: A dominant influence or authority over other states

factions.name: Imperium
factions.description: Supreme power or authority, often magical or divine

factions.name: Magocracy
factions.description: A government ruled by powerful magic users

factions.name: Gerontocracy
factions.description: A government ruled by the elderly

factions.name: Stratocracy
factions.description: A government ruled by military leaders

factions.name: Kleptocracy
factions.description: A government ruled by corrupt leaders

factions.name: Timocracy
factions.description: A government where property ownership determines power

factions.name: Nomocracy
factions.description: A government based on rule of law

factions.name: Polyarchy
factions.description: A government with multiple centers of power

factions.name: Diarchy
factions.description: A government ruled by two individuals

factions.name: Triarchy
factions.description: A government ruled by three individuals

factions.name: Tetrarchy
factions.description: A government ruled by four individuals

factions.name: Pentarchy
factions.description: A government ruled by five individuals

factions.name: Suzerainty
factions.description: A relationship where one state controls another's foreign policy

factions.name: Vassalage
factions.description: A relationship of allegiance to a more powerful overlord

factions.name: Atabegate
factions.description: Rule by an atabeg regent or governor

factions.name: Mamlukate
factions.description: Rule by mamluk slave-soldiers who gained power

factions.name: Timar
factions.description: Military service in exchange for land grants

factions.name: Zamindari
factions.description: System of landowners with administrative powers

factions.name: Jagir
factions.description: Noble service in exchange for territorial control

factions.name: Guild
factions.description: An association of craftsmen or merchants

factions.name: Order
factions.description: A religious or military organization with hierarchy

factions.name: Brotherhood
factions.description: A fraternal organization united by common purpose

factions.name: Sisterhood
factions.description: A sororal organization of women

factions.name: Cabal
factions.description: A secret group plotting together

factions.name: Coven
factions.description: A gathering of magic practitioners

factions.name: Circle
factions.description: A group united by common interest or practice

factions.name: Lodge
factions.description: A local chapter of a larger organization

factions.name: Chapter
factions.description: A branch of a larger organization

factions.name: Enclave
factions.description: A distinct group within a larger territory

factions.name: Sect
factions.description: A religious or philosophical subgroup

factions.name: Cult
factions.description: A religious group with particular devotion

factions.name: Society
factions.description: An organized group with shared purpose

factions.name: Association
factions.description: A group organized for a joint purpose

factions.name: Company
factions.description: A commercial or military organization

factions.name: Corporation
factions.description: A large commercial organization

factions.name: Conglomerate
factions.description: A large corporation of diverse businesses

factions.name: Monopoly
factions.description: Exclusive control of a trade or service

factions.name: Oligopoly
factions.description: Market control by a small group

factions.name: Trust
factions.description: A combination of firms for monopolistic purposes

factions.name: Combine
factions.description: An association for commercial or political purposes

factions.name: Faction
factions.description: A dissenting group within a larger group

factions.name: Party
factions.description: A political organization

factions.name: Movement
factions.description: A group working toward social or political change

factions.name: Resistance
factions.description: An underground organization opposing authority

factions.name: Rebellion
factions.description: An organized opposition to established authority

factions.name: Revolution
factions.description: A movement to overthrow existing power

factions.name: Insurgency
factions.description: An active revolt against authority

factions.name: Underground
factions.description: A secret resistance organization

factions.name: Network
factions.description: An interconnected group or system

factions.name: Web
factions.description: A complex system of connections

factions.name: Ring
factions.description: A circular organization, often secretive

factions.name: Cell
factions.description: A small unit of a larger organization

factions.name: Cadre
factions.description: A core group of trained personnel

factions.name: Vanguard
factions.description: The leading part of an advancing force

factions.name: Elite
factions.description: A select group considered superior

factions.name: Nobility
factions.description: The aristocratic class

factions.name: Gentry
factions.description: The landed aristocracy below nobility

factions.name: Patriciate
factions.description: The aristocratic class in republics

factions.name: Bourgeoisie
factions.description: The middle merchant class

factions.name: Proletariat
factions.description: The working class

factions.name: Peasantry
factions.description: The agricultural working class

factions.name: Clergy
factions.description: The religious leadership class

factions.name: Bureaucracy
factions.description: The administrative system of government

factions.name: Intelligentsia
factions.description: The intellectual elite

factions.name: Militia
factions.description: A citizen army

factions.name: Guard
factions.description: A protective military force

factions.name: Watch
factions.description: A civic protective force

factions.name: Patrol
factions.description: A mobile protective unit

factions.name: Brigade
factions.description: A tactical military unit

factions.name: Regiment
factions.description: A military unit

factions.name: Battalion
factions.description: A large military unit

factions.name: Squadron
factions.description: A military or naval unit

factions.name: Platoon
factions.description: A military unit subdivision

factions.name: Squad
factions.description: A small military unit

factions.name: Crew
factions.description: A working team

factions.name: Gang
factions.description: An organized group, often criminal

factions.name: Band
factions.description: A group of people with common purpose

factions.name: Troupe
factions.description: A company of performers

factions.name: Tribe
factions.description: A social division in traditional society

factions.name: Clan
factions.description: A kinship group

factions.name: House
factions.description: A noble or merchant family organization

factions.name: Dynasty
factions.description: A line of hereditary rulers

factions.name: Lineage
factions.description: A line of descent

factions.name: Bloodline
factions.description: A family line of descent

factions.name: Covenant
factions.description: A binding agreement or religious group

factions.name: Compact
factions.description: A formal agreement between parties

factions.name: Pact
factions.description: A formal agreement

factions.name: Treaty
factions.description: A formal agreement between states

factions.name: Accord
factions.description: An agreement or harmony between parties

factions.name: Concordat
factions.description: An agreement, especially with religious authority

factions.name: Charter
factions.description: A written grant of rights

factions.name: Constitution
factions.description: Fundamental principles of governance

factions.name: Assembly
factions.description: A group gathered for common purpose

factions.name: Congress
factions.description: A formal meeting or legislative body

factions.name: Senate
factions.description: An upper legislative chamber

factions.name: Chamber
factions.description: A legislative or judicial body

factions.name: Court
factions.description: A judicial body or royal household

factions.name: Tribunal
factions.description: A court of justice

factions.name: Inquisition
factions.description: An investigation body, often religious

factions.name: Commission
factions.description: A group authorized for specific duties

factions.name: Committee
factions.description: A group appointed for specific function

factions.name: Board
factions.description: A governing body

factions.name: Panel
factions.description: A small group for discussion or judgment

factions.name: Jury
factions.description: A body for making determinations

factions.name: Quorum
factions.description: The minimum members for valid proceedings

factions.name: Caucus
factions.description: A meeting of party members

factions.name: Convention

factions.name: Symposium
factions.description: A conference or meeting

factions.name: Conclave

factions.name: Summit
factions.description: A meeting of high-level officials

factions.name: Forum
factions.description: A place or meeting for discussion

factions.name: Plaza
factions.description: A public square or marketplace

factions.name: Exchange
factions.description: A marketplace or trading center

factions.name: Market
factions.description: A regular gathering for trade

factions.name: Bazaar
factions.description: A marketplace, often exotic

factions.name: Emporium
factions.description: A large commercial establishment

factions.name: Monopoly
factions.description: Exclusive control of trade

factions.name: Franchise
factions.description: A license to operate under established brand

factions.name: Concern
factions.description: A business organization

factions.name: Enterprise
factions.description: A business or undertaking

factions.name: Venture

factions.name: Undertaking
factions.description: A formal pledge or enterprise

factions.name: Operation
factions.description: An organized activity

factions.name: Campaign
factions.description: An organized course of action

factions.name: Crusade
factions.description: A vigorous campaign for a cause

factions.name: Mission
factions.description: An important assignment

factions.name: Quest
factions.description: A long search for something

factions.name: Expedition
factions.description: A journey for a specific purpose

factions.name: Voyage

factions.name: Pilgrimage
factions.description: A journey to a sacred place

factions.name: Odyssey
factions.description: A long eventful journey

factions.name: Exodus

factions.name: Diaspora
factions.description: A scattered population

factions.name: Settlement
factions.description: A place where people establish community

factions.name: Outpost

factions.name: Station
factions.description: A place established for specific purpose

factions.name: Post
factions.description: A place of duty or trading

factions.name: Fort

factions.name: Fortress

factions.name: Citadel

factions.name: Redoubt

factions.name: Garrison

factions.name: Barracks
factions.description: Military housing

factions.name: Academy
factions.description: An institution of learning

factions.name: Institute
factions.description: An organization for promotion of cause

factions.name: University

factions.name: School
factions.description: An institution for education

factions.name: Seminary
factions.description: A training institution

factions.name: Monastery
factions.description: A religious community residence

factions.name: Convent
factions.description: A religious community for women

factions.name: Temple
factions.description: A place of worship

factions.name: Shrine
factions.description: A holy or sacred place

factions.name: Sanctuary

factions.name: Cathedral
factions.description: A principal church

factions.name: Mosque

factions.name: Synagogue

factions.description: A place of divine communication

factions.name: Hospice

factions.name: Hospital
factions.description: A place for medical treatment

factions.description: A place for the sick

factions.description: A place of refuge or care

factions.name: Refuge
factions.description: A place of shelter

factions.name: Haven

factions.name: Sanctum
factions.description: A sacred or private place

factions.name: Retreat
factions.description: A quiet or secluded place

factions.name: Hermitage

factions.name: Cloister

factions.name: Archive
factions.description: A place for historical records

factions.name: Library
factions.description: A place for books and learning

factions.name: Museum
factions.description: A place for preservation and display

factions.description: A place for art display

factions.description: A place for manufacturing

factions.description: A place for crafting

factions.name: Studio
factions.description: A place for artistic work

factions.name: Laboratory
factions.description: A place for experiments

factions.name: Observatory
factions.description: A place for observation

factions.name: Lighthouse
factions.description: A tower with a beacon

factions.name: Watchtower
factions.description: A tower for observation

factions.name: Spire
factions.description: A tall pointed structure

factions.name: Minaret
factions.description: A tower for prayer calls

factions.name: Belfry
factions.description: A bell tower

factions.name: Keep
factions.description: The strongest tower of a castle

factions.name: Donjon
factions.description: The great tower of a castle

factions.name: Dungeon
factions.description: An underground prison

factions.name: Prison
factions.description: A place of confinement

factions.name: Jail
factions.description: A place for holding prisoners

factions.name: Penitentiary
factions.description: A prison for serious offenders

factions.name: Stockade
factions.description: A prison or defensive barrier

factions.name: Brig
factions.description: A prison, especially on a ship

factions.name: Oubliette
factions.description: A secret dungeon

factions.name: Guild
factions.description: An association of merchants who control trade in specific goods or regions, often wielding significant economic power

factions.name: Tribe
factions.description: A nomadic group that relies on hunting and gathering for sustenance, moving seasonally to find resources

factions.name: Religion
factions.description: A formal religious institution with established hierarchy, doctrine, and widespread influence

factions.name: Cult
factions.description: A small religious group with unconventional beliefs, often secretive and devoted to a specific deity or cause

factions.name: Order
factions.description: A religious community of monks or nuns who live according to specific spiritual rules and vows

factions.name: Company
factions.description: A professional military unit that sells its services to the highest bidder, with no permanent allegiance

factions.name: Army
factions.description: A permanent military force maintained by a state during peacetime and war

factions.name: Secret Society
factions.description: A clandestine organization with hidden membership, goals, and activities, often pursuing power or knowledge

factions.name: Trading Company
factions.description: A commercial enterprise engaged in long-distance trade, often with significant economic and political power

factions.name: Crew
factions.description: A group of maritime criminals who engage in robbery, raiding, and other illegal activities at sea

factions.name: Gang
factions.description: A group of outlaws who prey on travelers, merchants, and settlements through robbery and violence

factions.name: Circle
factions.description: An association of spellcasters who share knowledge, regulate magical practice, and pursue arcane research

factions.name: College
factions.description: An institution where bards learn music, lore, and performance arts, often serving as information networks

factions.name: University
factions.description: An institution of higher learning where scholars study various subjects and conduct research

factions.name: Coven
factions.description: A small group of practitioners of witchcraft or hedge magic, often operating in secret

factions.name: Cartel
factions.description: A criminal organization that controls illegal trade, often in drugs, weapons, or other contraband

factions.name: Syndicate
factions.description: A large criminal organization with extensive networks and influence in both legal and illegal enterprises

factions.name: Militia
factions.description: A part-time military force of citizen-soldiers who defend their community when needed

factions.name: Inquisition
factions.description: A religious or governmental organization dedicated to rooting out heresy, corruption, or other threats

factions.name: Spy Network
factions.description: An intelligence organization that gathers information through espionage and covert operations

factions.name: Rebels
factions.description: A resistance movement fighting against established authority or occupying forces

factions.name: Separatists
factions.description: A political movement seeking independence or autonomy from a larger political entity

factions.name: Refugees
factions.description: A displaced population seeking shelter and safety after fleeing their homeland due to war, disaster, or persecution

factions.name: Clan
factions.description: A wandering family group that moves seasonally across territories, often following trade routes or resources

factions.name: Commune
factions.description: A community living in harmony with forest environments, often skilled in woodcraft and herbalism

factions.name: Consortium
factions.description: A business organization that controls mining operations and the extraction of valuable minerals

factions.name: Cooperative
factions.description: A group of agricultural producers who work together to share resources and market their goods

factions.name: Collective
factions.description: A group of skilled craftspeople who collaborate on projects and share techniques and resources

factions.name: League
factions.description: An organization of adventurers and researchers dedicated to discovering new lands and phenomena

factions.name: School
factions.description: An organization that trains fighters for arena combat and entertainment

factions.name: Circus
factions.description: A mobile entertainment troupe that performs shows while moving from town to town

factions.name: Troupe
factions.description: A group of performers who stage theatrical productions and travel to various venues

factions.name: Pilgrims
factions.description: A religious group undertaking a spiritual journey to sacred sites or shrines

factions.name: Monastery
factions.description: A religious community where monks or nuns live in seclusion, dedicated to prayer and contemplation

factions.name: Abbey
factions.description: A large religious community headed by an abbot or abbess, often controlling significant land and resources

factions.name: Convent
factions.description: A religious community of nuns or sisters dedicated to spiritual life and often charitable works

factions.name: Hierarchy
factions.description: The organizational structure of a major religious institution, with priests, acolytes, and other clergy

factions.name: Sect
factions.description: A religious group whose beliefs deviate from orthodox doctrine, often persecuted by mainstream religion

factions.name: Elementalists
factions.description: A magical organization focused on the study and mastery of elemental forces

factions.name: Cabal
factions.description: A dark magical organization that practices death magic and communication with undead spirits

factions.name: Pact
factions.description: A group of spellcasters bound together by shared patrons or similar sources of otherworldly power

factions.name: Bloodline
factions.description: A family or group connected by shared magical heritage and innate spellcasting abilities

factions.name: Academy
factions.description: An educational institution dedicated to teaching formal magical theory and spellcasting techniques

factions.name: Workshop
factions.description: A group of magical inventors who create mechanical devices enhanced with magical properties

factions.name: Creature Hunters
factions.description: An organization dedicated to hunting and destroying vampires and other undead creatures

factions.name: Inquisitors
factions.description: A religious or governmental organization that investigates and punishes heresy, corruption, or supernatural threats

factions.name: Knights
factions.description: A militant order that serves evil powers, often as the counterpart to paladins

factions.name: Sellswords
factions.description: Individual mercenaries or small groups who sell their martial skills to whoever pays them

factions.name: War Band
factions.description: A loose military formation of warriors united for raiding, conquest, or mutual protection

factions.name: Unit
factions.description: A specialized military formation focused on mounted combat and rapid movement

factions.name: Engineers
factions.description: A military organization specializing in the construction and operation of siege equipment

factions.name: Fleet
factions.description: A military or commercial organization operating multiple ships for warfare, trade, or exploration

factions.name: Corsairs
factions.description: State-sanctioned pirates who attack enemy shipping while technically serving a government

factions.name: Privateers
factions.description: Licensed pirates who operate with government permission to attack specific targets

factions.name: Ring
factions.description: A criminal network specializing in the illegal transportation of goods across borders

factions.name: Network
factions.description: A criminal organization that specializes in buying and selling stolen goods

factions.name: House
factions.description: An organization that operates games of chance and often serves as a front for other criminal activities

factions.name: Racket
factions.description: A criminal organization that extorts money from businesses in exchange for 'protection' from threats

factions.name: Brokers
factions.description: An organization that gathers and sells information, secrets, and intelligence to interested parties

factions.name: Traders
factions.description: A criminal organization involved in the capture, transport, and sale of sentient beings as property

factions.name: Dealers
factions.description: An organization that illegally sells weapons, often to both sides of conflicts for profit

factions.name: Counterfeiters
factions.description: A criminal group specializing in creating fake currency, documents, or valuable items

factions.name: Con Artists
factions.description: A group of criminals who specialize in confidence tricks and elaborate fraudulent schemes

factions.name: Grave Robbers
factions.description: A criminal organization that steals from tombs, crypts, and burial sites for profit

factions.name: Crime Ring
factions.description: A criminal organization that specializes in abducting people for ransom or other purposes

factions.name: Social Club
factions.description: An exclusive gathering of people with shared interests, often serving as a networking hub for the elite

factions.name: Political Faction
factions.description: A group within a larger organization that advocates for specific policies, ideologies, or power structures

factions.name: Trade Union
factions.description: An organization of workers who band together to protect their rights and improve working conditions

factions.name: Academic Circle
factions.description: A group of scholars and researchers who collaborate on specific fields of study or intellectual pursuits

factions.name: Noble Faction
factions.description: A coalition of aristocratic families who work together to advance their political and economic interests

factions.name: Religious Sect
factions.description: A subgroup within a larger religion that follows specific interpretations of doctrine or practices

factions.name: Criminal Syndicate
factions.description: A large-scale criminal organization with multiple operations and significant influence in illegal enterprises

factions.name: Cultural Enclave
factions.description: A community of people who share ethnic, cultural, or linguistic heritage, often living in concentrated areas

factions.name: Merchant Consortium
factions.description: A powerful alliance of wealthy traders who control major trade routes and economic resources

factions.name: Artistic Movement
factions.description: A group of artists, writers, and performers who share aesthetic philosophies and creative goals

factions.name: Philosophical School
factions.description: A group of thinkers who follow and develop specific philosophical traditions or worldviews

factions.name: Revolutionary Cell
factions.description: A secretive group dedicated to overthrowing the current social or political order

factions.name: Conservation Society
factions.description: An organization dedicated to preserving natural resources, historical sites, or cultural traditions

factions.name: Innovation Collective
factions.description: A group of inventors, engineers, and visionaries pushing the boundaries of technology and knowledge

factions.name: Traditionalist League
factions.description: A group that resists change and seeks to preserve established customs, values, and ways of life

factions.name: Relief Organization
factions.description: A group dedicated to providing aid, medical care, and support to those in need

factions.name: Entertainment Troupe
factions.description: A traveling group of performers, musicians, or entertainers who bring culture and diversion to communities

factions.name: Sports League
factions.description: An organization that regulates competitive activities and fosters community through athletic competition

factions.name: Literary Society
factions.description: A group of writers, poets, and bibliophiles who promote literature and intellectual discourse

factions.name: Research Expedition
factions.description: A team of researchers and explorers dedicated to uncovering ancient ruins and historical artifacts

factions.name: Medical Association
factions.description: A professional organization of healers, doctors, and medical researchers who share knowledge and standards

factions.name: Legal Consortium
factions.description: A group of lawyers, judges, and legal scholars who work together on complex cases and legal reforms

factions.name: Agricultural Cooperative
factions.description: A group of farmers who work together to share resources, knowledge, and market their products

factions.name: Banking Cartel
factions.description: A powerful alliance of financial institutions that control lending, currency, and economic policy

factions.name: Mining Syndicate
factions.description: A powerful organization that controls mineral extraction and often wields significant economic and political influence

factions.name: Association
factions.description: An organization of ale-makers and vintners who control the production and distribution of alcoholic beverages

factions.name: Brotherhood
factions.description: A guild of bread-makers and pastry chefs who provide essential food services to communities

factions.name: Union
factions.description: An organization of woodworkers who build structures, furniture, and other wooden goods

factions.name: Caravan

factions.name: Enterprise

factions.name: Venture

factions.name: Expedition

factions.description: An organization providing a particular service

factions.name: Bureau

factions.name: Lodge

factions.name: Foundry

factions.description: A group of people organized for a common interest

factions.description: A group of people with a common interest or purpose

factions.name: Class

factions.name: Corp

factions.name: Society

factions.name: Corps
